alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Ford; Meade; Pawnee; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 1:34PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches expected. Locally higher amounts to near 6 inches are possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, southwest and west central Kansas. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...The combination of accumulating snow and intense north winds will produce widespread blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be near zero at times, especially on open rural highways, and especially Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winter driving conditions will spread rapidly and abruptly eastward Monday afternoon into Monday night. Conditions will change quickly over short times and distances, and motorists are urged to be prepared for the onset of dangerous travel.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
